data.title: 12 Things You Can Do In Vilnius The Capital Of Lithuania
data.text:
Vilnius, Lithuania

Located in the heart of Europe, Vilnius is the capital city of Lithuania, a country that has quickly become one of the hottest travel destinations in Europe. With its stunning architecture, rich history, and vibrant culture, Vilnius has something to offer everyone. In this post, we will explore some of the best things to do in Vilnius.

1) Explore The Old Town

The Old Town of Vilnius is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is one of the most well-preserved mediaeval cities in Europe. You can wander through the narrow cobblestone streets, marvel at the stunning Baroque architecture, and soak in the charming atmosphere. Make sure to visit the Cathedral Square, which is the main square of the city and the heart of the Old Town.

2) Visit The Hill of Three Crosses

The Hill of Three Crosses is a must-visit destination in Vilnius. It is located on the top of a hill and offers breathtaking views of the city. According to legend, the crosses were erected to commemorate three monks who were martyred in the 14th century. It's a bit of a hike to reach the top, but the views are well worth it.

3) Take A Stroll Through Užupis

Užupis is a bohemian neighbourhood located in the heart of Vilnius. It's known for its vibrant street art, quirky shops, and hip cafes. The neighbourhood is also home to the Republic of Užupis, a self-proclaimed independent state with its own constitution and anthem. It's a fun and unique place to explore, and you might even run into some of the local artists and musicians.

4) Visit The Palace of The Grand Dukes of Lithuania

The Palace of the Grand Dukes of Lithuania is a beautiful and historic building located in the heart of Vilnius. It was originally built in the 15th century for the Grand Duke of Lithuania and was later reconstructed in the 20th century. Today, it houses a museum that showcases the history of Lithuania and the Grand Dukes who ruled the country.

5) Explore The Vilnius TV Tower

The Vilnius TV Tower is the tallest building in Lithuania and offers breathtaking views of the city. It's located just outside of the city center and can be reached by public transport. The tower has an observation deck and a restaurant, making it a great place to spend an afternoon.

6) Relax In The Parks

Vilnius is home to many beautiful parks and green spaces. The Bernardine Gardens, located in the heart of the city, are a great place to relax and unwind. The Vingis Park is another popular destination, and it's a great place to go for a run or a bike ride.

7) Visit the National Museum of Lithuania

The National Museum of Lithuania is one of the oldest and most important museums in the country. It's located in a beautiful historic building and houses a vast collection of artefacts that tell the story of Lithuania's rich history. The museum is a great place to learn about the culture and traditions of the Lithuanian people.

8) Take A Day Trip To Trakai

Trakai is a picturesque town located just outside of Vilnius. It's known for its stunning castle, which is located on an island in the middle of a lake. The castle dates back to the 14th century and is a great place to explore. Trakai is also home to many restaurants and cafes, making it a great place to spend a day.

9) Enjoy the Food and Drink Scene

Vilnius has a fantastic food and drink scene, with many restaurants and bars offering traditional Lithuanian cuisine and local beers. Some of the must-try dishes include cepelinai (potato dumplings stuffed with meat or cheese), kibinai (savoury pastries filled with meat or vegetables), and šaltibarščiai (a refreshing cold soup made with beets and sour cream). Make sure to also try some local beers like Svyturys and Kalnapilis.

10) Visit The Museum of Genocide Victims

The Museum of Genocide Victims is a sobering reminder of Lithuania's dark past. It's located in a former KGB prison and showcases the atrocities committed by the Soviet and Nazi regimes during the 20th century. It's a must-visit destination for anyone interested in learning about the history of Lithuania.

11) Attend a Festival or Event

Vilnius hosts many festivals and events throughout the year, showcasing the country's rich culture and traditions. Some of the most popular events include the Vilnius Jazz Festival, the Vilnius Film Festival, and the Kaziukas Fair, a traditional celebration held in March. Make sure to check the calendar of events when planning your trip to Vilnius.

12) Explore the Open-Air Museum of the Centre of Europe

The Open-Air Museum of the Centre of Europe is a unique attraction located just outside of Vilnius. It's a collection of traditional farmsteads and buildings from different parts of Lithuania that have been moved to this location to preserve the country's cultural heritage. Visitors can explore the farmsteads and learn about the traditional way of life in Lithuania.

Is Vilnius The City For You?

In conclusion, Vilnius is a beautiful and historic city that has something to offer everyone. Whether you're interested in history, culture, or just want to relax and unwind, there's plenty to see. In conclusion, Vilnius is a city full of surprises and is definitely worth a visit. With its stunning architecture, rich history, vibrant culture, and fantastic food and drink scene, there's something for everyone to enjoy. Whether you're interested in exploring the Old Town, visiting museums and galleries, or simply relaxing in the parks and green spaces, Vilnius has it all.
